title: Synthetic Recap
body:
SAN FRANCISCO — On a night where the final score was secondary, the Orlando Magic’s Tracy McGrady authored a performance for the ages, pouring in a breathtaking 46 points in a 104-89 loss to the Golden State Warriors.

From the opening tip, it was clear this was McGrady’s stage. The explosive guard sliced through the Warriors’ defense with an unstoppable combination of silky jump shots and explosive drives to the rim. He was a one-man offensive tsunami, single-handedly keeping the Magic within striking distance through three quarters. Despite his heroic efforts, Orlando could muster little offensive support to counter the Warriors’ balanced attack.

Golden State’s victory was a testament to collective effort. Led by Antawn Jamison’s 22 points and 11 rebounds, the Warriors consistently found answers. Jason Caffey provided a powerful inside presence with a double-double of 19 points and 12 boards, while Mookie Blaylock orchestrated the offense with 15 points and 11 assists. Whenever McGrady would bring Orlando close, the Warriors had multiple players step up with a critical basket to maintain their advantage.

Ultimately, the Warriors’ depth proved too much for McGrady’s singular brilliance. They methodically pulled away in the final period, turning a close contest into a decisive 15-point victory.

But the story of this night, and the one that will echo in the annals of NBA history, belongs to Tracy McGrady. In a losing effort, his 46-point tour de force was a stunning display of individual talent, a performance so dominant it transcended the final outcome and stood alone as a masterpiece.
